channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: OpticFusion: Multi-Modal Neural Implicit 3D Reconstruction of Microstructures by Fusing White Light Interferometry and Optical Microscopy
item.description: However, conventional WLI cannot capture the natural color of a sample's surface, which is essential for many microscale research applications that require both 3D geometry and color information.

item.title: Practical Continual Forgetting for Pre-trained Vision Models
item.description: (ii) For remaining knowledge, the impact brought by the forgetting procedure should be minimal.

item.title: Cueless EEG imagined speech for subject identification: dataset and benchmarks
item.description: Electroencephalogram (EEG) signals have emerged as a promising modality for biometric identification.

item.title: Teaching Wav2Vec2 the Language of the Brain
item.description: In contrast, labeled data and pre-trained models for the closely related task of speech recognition from audio are widely available.

item.title: Multi-task deep-learning for sleep event detection and stage classification
item.description: This is complex, for which identification of different types of events involves focusing on different subsets of signals, resulting on an iterative time-consuming process entailing several visual analysis passes.

item.title: SRE-Conv: Symmetric Rotation Equivariant Convolution for Biomedical Image Classification
item.description: Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are essential tools for computer vision tasks, but they lack traditionally desired properties of extracted features that could further improve model performance, e. g., rotational equivariance.

item.title: Normal-NeRF: Ambiguity-Robust Normal Estimation for Highly Reflective Scenes
item.description: Combined with a reflection-aware appearance model, our proposed method achieves robust reconstruction and high-fidelity rendering of scenes featuring both highly specular reflections and intricate geometric structures.

item.title: Multimodal Marvels of Deep Learning in Medical Diagnosis: A Comprehensive Review of COVID-19 Detection
item.description: Our analysis revealed that the MobileNet model achieved the highest accuracy of 99. 97% for COVID-19 image data and 93. 73% for speech data (i. e., cough).

item.title: DEFOM-Stereo: Depth Foundation Model Based Stereo Matching
item.description: Thus, to facilitate robust stereo matching with monocular depth cues, we incorporate a robust monocular relative depth model into the recurrent stereo-matching framework, building a new framework for depth foundation model-based stereo-matching, DEFOM-Stereo.

item.title: Merging Models on the Fly Without Retraining: A Sequential Approach to Scalable Continual Model Merging
item.description: In this study, we propose a training-free projection-based continual merging method that processes models sequentially through orthogonal projections of weight matrices and adaptive scaling mechanisms.

item.title: Scaling up self-supervised learning for improved surgical foundation models
item.description: Trained on the largest reported surgical dataset to date, comprising over 4. 7 million video frames, SurgeNetXL achieves consistent top-tier performance across six datasets spanning four surgical procedures and three tasks, including semantic segmentation, phase recognition, and critical view of safety (CVS) classification.

item.title: Weight for Robustness: A Comprehensive Approach towards Optimal Fault-Tolerant Asynchronous ML
item.description: We address the challenges of Byzantine-robust training in asynchronous distributed machine learning systems, aiming to enhance efficiency amid massive parallelization and heterogeneous computing resources.

item.title: Neural Honeytrace: A Robust Plug-and-Play Watermarking Framework against Model Extraction Attacks
item.description: Guided by the model, we further introduce: (1) a similarity-based training-free watermarking method for plug-and-play and flexible watermarking, and (2) a distribution-based multi-step watermark information transmission strategy for robust watermarking.

item.title: On Learning Informative Trajectory Embeddings for Imitation, Classification and Regression
item.description: In real-world sequential decision making tasks like autonomous driving, robotics, and healthcare, learning from observed state-action trajectories is critical for tasks like imitation, classification, and clustering.

item.title: Class Incremental Fault Diagnosis under Limited Fault Data via Supervised Contrastive Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Class-incremental fault diagnosis requires a model to adapt to new fault classes while retaining previous knowledge.

item.title: NS-Gym: Open-Source Simulation Environments and Benchmarks for Non-Stationary Markov Decision Processes
item.description: This toolkit is the first effort to develop a set of standardized interfaces and benchmark problems to enable consistent and reproducible evaluation of algorithms under non-stationary conditions.

item.title: MatrixNet: Learning over symmetry groups using learned group representations
item.description: Group theory has been used in machine learning to provide a theoretically grounded approach for incorporating known symmetry transformations in tasks from robotics to protein modeling.

item.title: A Simple Aerial Detection Baseline of Multimodal Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we present a simple baseline for applying MLMs to aerial detection for the first time, named LMMRotate.

item.title: LAVCap: LLM-based Audio-Visual Captioning using Optimal Transport
item.description: LAVCap employs an optimal transport-based alignment loss to bridge the modality gap between audio and visual features, enabling more effective semantic extraction.

item.title: From Scarcity to Capability: Empowering Fake News Detection in Low-Resource Languages with LLMs
item.description: This version includes 11, 700 additional, meticulously curated fake news articles validated from credible sources, creating a proportional dataset of 47, 000 authentic and 13, 000 fake news items across 13 categories.

item.title: Boosting Short Text Classification with Multi-Source Information Exploration and Dual-Level Contrastive Learning
item.description: We propose a novel model named MI-DELIGHT for short text classification in this work.

item.title: A Simple Graph Contrastive Learning Framework for Short Text Classification
item.description: Subsequently, we directly apply contrastive learning on these embeddings.

item.title: ChartInsighter: An Approach for Mitigating Hallucination in Time-series Chart Summary Generation with A Benchmark Dataset
item.description: We introduce ChartInsighter, which automatically generates chart summaries of time-series data, effectively reducing hallucinations in chart summary generation.

item.title: Analyzing Continuous Semantic Shifts with Diachronic Word Similarity Matrices
item.description: The meanings and relationships of words shift over time.

item.title: TCMM: Token Constraint and Multi-Scale Memory Bank of Contrastive Learning for Unsupervised Person Re-identification
item.description: This paper proposes the ViT Token Constraint and Multi-scale Memory bank (TCMM) method to address the patch noises and feature inconsistency in unsupervised person re-identification works.

item.title: Tracking the Takes and Trajectories of English-Language News Narratives across Trustworthy and Worrisome Websites
item.description: Understanding how misleading and outright false information enters news ecosystems remains a difficult challenge that requires tracking how narratives spread across thousands of fringe and mainstream news websites.

item.title: SwinTExCo: Exemplar-based video colorization using Swin Transformer
item.description: Video colorization represents a compelling domain within the field of Computer Vision.

item.title: Knowledge prompt chaining for semantic modeling
item.description: In this paper, we proposed a novel automatic semantic modeling framework: Knowledge Prompt Chaining.

item.title: Molecular Graph Contrastive Learning with Line Graph
item.description: Trapped by the label scarcity in molecular property prediction and drug design, graph contrastive learning (GCL) came forward.

item.title: Agentic Retrieval-Augmented Generation: A Survey on Agentic RAG
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have revolutionized artificial intelligence (AI) by enabling human like text generation and natural language understanding.

item.title: Generative Medical Image Anonymization Based on Latent Code Projection and Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we address the medical image anonymization problem with a two-stage solution: latent code projection and optimization.

item.title: Score-based 3D molecule generation with neural fields
item.description: Using this representation, we propose a new model based on walk-jump sampling for unconditional 3D molecule generation in the continuous space using neural fields.

item.title: Complexity Control Facilitates Reasoning-Based Compositional Generalization in Transformers
item.description: Transformers have demonstrated impressive capabilities across various tasks, yet their performance on compositional problems remains a subject of debate.

item.title: SuperSAM: Crafting a SAM Supernetwork via Structured Pruning and Unstructured Parameter Prioritization
item.description: Neural Architecture Search (NAS) is a powerful approach of automating the design of efficient neural architectures.

item.title: Multilingual LLMs Struggle to Link Orthography and Semantics in Bilingual Word Processing
item.description: Bilingual lexical processing is shaped by the complex interplay of phonological, orthographic, and semantic features of two languages within an integrated mental lexicon.

item.title: Self-supervised Transformation Learning for Equivariant Representations
item.description: However, current methods depend on transformation labels and thus struggle with interdependency and complex transformations.

item.title: ToMATO: Verbalizing the Mental States of Role-Playing LLMs for Benchmarking Theory of Mind
item.description: These verbalized thoughts serve as answers to questions designed to assess the mental states of characters within conversations.

item.title: Generative diffusion model with inverse renormalization group flows
item.description: Here we introduce a renormalization group-based diffusion model that leverages multiscale nature of data distributions for realizing a high-quality data generation.

item.title: How Do Generative Models Draw a Software Engineer? A Case Study on Stable Diffusion Bias
item.description: Hence, if used without consciousness, artificially generated images could reinforce these biases in the SE domain.

item.title: Karatsuba Matrix Multiplication and its Efficient Custom Hardware Implementations
item.description: In this work, we propose the extension of the scalar Karatsuba multiplication algorithm to matrix multiplication, showing how this maintains the reduction in multiplication complexity of the original Karatsuba algorithm while reducing the complexity of the extra additions.

item.title: Visual WetlandBirds Dataset: Bird Species Identification and Behavior Recognition in Videos
item.description: The current biodiversity loss crisis makes animal monitoring a relevant field of study.

item.title: Pseudolabel guided pixels contrast for domain adaptive semantic segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) for semantic segmentation is a technique that uses virtual data with labels to train a model and adapts it to real data without labels.

item.title: A Vessel Bifurcation Landmark Pair Dataset for Abdominal CT Deformable Image Registration (DIR) Validation
item.description: 2) Matching image patches were manually identified between two CTs of each image pair 3) Vessel bifurcation landmarks were labeled on one image of each image patch pair.

item.title: The Inherent Limits of Pretrained LLMs: The Unexpected Convergence of Instruction Tuning and In-Context Learning Capabilities
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs), trained on extensive web-scale corpora, have demonstrated remarkable abilities across diverse tasks, especially as they are scaled up.

item.title: Multimodal LLMs Can Reason about Aesthetics in Zero-Shot
item.description: We present the first study on how Multimodal LLMs' (MLLMs) reasoning ability shall be elicited to evaluate the aesthetics of artworks.

item.title: Disjoint Processing Mechanisms of Hierarchical and Linear Grammars in Large Language Models
item.description: Using these grammars, we first observe that language models show distinct behaviors on hierarchical versus linearly structured inputs.

item.title: Mantis Shrimp: Exploring Photometric Band Utilization in Computer Vision Networks for Photometric Redshift Estimation
item.description: In comparison to tabular models, image models have additional design complexities: it is largely unknown how to fuse inputs from different instruments which have different resolutions or noise properties.

item.title: CityDreamer4D: Compositional Generative Model of Unbounded 4D Cities
item.description: Our main insights are 1) 4D city generation should separate dynamic objects (e. g., vehicles) from static scenes (e. g., buildings and roads), and 2) all objects in the 4D scene should be composed of different types of neural fields for buildings, vehicles, and background stuff.

item.title: Decompose-ToM: Enhancing Theory of Mind Reasoning in Large Language Models through Simulation and Task Decomposition
item.description: Theory of Mind (ToM) is the ability to understand and reflect on the mental states of others.

item.title: Guiding Retrieval using LLM-based Listwise Rankers
item.description: In this paper, we propose an adaptation of an existing adaptive retrieval method that supports the listwise setting and helps guide the retrieval process itself (thereby overcoming the bounded recall problem for LLM rerankers).
